pullRequest.body:
The polar of a set closed under scalar multiplication the set of functionals vanishing on the set.

In particular this applies to submodules.

Example application: #14369

---

### PR summary [98c18162a1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14458/commits/98c18162a198fadd6ea2562df93a46f535895ead)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ polarSubmodule`
`+ polar_subMulAction`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9948092758/job/27482004009)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9948092758/job/27482004301)

Do we have `{y | ∀ x ∈ m, B x y = 0}` (a.k.a. the intersection of all `(B x).ker`) as a submodule for any set (can't find it)? If yes, then we should have a lemma saying that `polar` is equal to this set instead of adding a new definition. If no, then please ask on Zulip if we should add it or go ahead with `polarSubmodule`.
Did you try `by_contra!` or `contrapose!` to auto push negation?
I think that we should use `{S : Type*} [SetLike S E] [SubMulActionClass S 𝕜 E] (m : S)` so that the lemma automatically applies to `Submodule`s.

Golfed by using `contrapose!` and `intro`ducing more variables.
```suggestion
  ext y
  constructor
  · intro hy x hx
    obtain ⟨r, hr⟩ := NormedField.exists_lt_norm 𝕜 ‖B x y‖⁻¹
    contrapose! hr
    rw [← one_div, le_div_iff (norm_pos_iff.2 hr)]
    simpa using  hy _ (SMulMemClass.smul_mem r hx)
  · intro h x hx
    simp [h x hx]
```

```suggestion
  .copy (⨅ x ∈ m, LinearMap.ker (B x)) (B.polar m) <| by ext; simp [polar_subMulAction]
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Analysis/LocallyConvex/Polar): Calculate the polar of a set closed under scalar multiplication
